Apathetic staff on terrace
reviews.text: We (My mother and I) thoroughly enjoyed our recent visit to this restaurant and cannot fault it. We had an extremely friendly, professional and helpful waiter, Simone, who was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and did his best to make recommendations for us based on what we liked and what we had eaten the previous day - which was no mean feat for two indecisive diners with all the time in the world.

All of our food was absolutely delicious - and we wouldn't make this comment lightly. We had eggs benedict to share as a starter (and they very kindly split it neatly onto two plates for us), followed by scallops and an open crab sandwich. Portion sizes were also very reasonable for the price. Service was prompt but not rushed, which is exactly how we think it should be.
reviews.title: Review of Captains Club RESTAURANT not hotel

reviews.text: The view and the atmosphere were also lovely, all of which made for a very enjoyable lunch. We would not hesitate to recommend it and we hope to return again soon.

reviews.text: I love deco and the overall impression from the entrance foyeur throughout the bar is subtle Art Deco with a very modern, crisp twist, I love the decor here. Added to by the wall of window making the most of the beautiful location on the river. Drinks expensive but then it is to be expected at such a venue. Service was excellent and very friendly, not starchy but perfectly proper. Balance achieved. I love the casual dining area tables and chairs, lovely combination of colours.
reviews.title: Poor everything!

reviews.text: A friend and I only visited for drinks and chat and werent able to use the outside space as it was raining. The sofas in the bar area are rather long in the leg though...ideal for a little subtle canoodle type conversation between couples but not so easy to be comfortable to chat the appropriate distance from a friend...you are almost lying down! I tried the chocolate torte, again expensive but delicious. I wouldnt let the prices put me off returning, it is lovely. I look forward to return for a proper meal and hopefully enjoy the outside dining.
reviews.title: Badly down hill

reviews.text: We last went about two years ago and had a good lunch, so were happy to take friends who wanted to try it. We waited and waited to even be asked if we wanted a drink, eventually being 'noticed' and an order was taken. We asked for menus to look at as we had booked and were already 10 minutes behind on the time we had asked for a table. After approx. 10 minutes we were given 1 menu between 4 of us! Still no drinks, meanwhile newcomers to the bar had been served. Eventually our order was taken, but there were various items which had been removed (it was only 8 pm!) We asked to be seated and wine order taken. This was grudgingly done and we carried our own drinks to the table!! The food was decidedly indifferent and the service poor - to the extent that we had to complain and this is truly not something we usually do, plus the embarrassment of having taken friends, who will certainly never go again. I would like to add that we are not cheapskates, as we were drinking champagne! Sorry, they need to realise that the 'yuppies' at the bar are not the only customers, and neither do they eat! It is sad, as this is a lovely setting, position, and could be a favourite venue for us - As it is we will need a lot of persuading to feel we want to risk spending a fairly considerable amount of money there again.
reviews.title: Nice food, worst service ever!
Enjoyable evening!
reviews.text: We visited on a Saturday night and whilst the guys making the cocktail surpassed themselves as ever the restaurant was a let down. We've been going to this place for several years and up till now it's been somewhere to look forward to. It now seems someone has had the idea of catering for a wider audience and in doing so dropped standards significantly. Just like a previous reviewer we could get anything without having to ask for it and anything ordered took ages to arrive. The first disappointment was the menu whereby the old al-la-carte is gone and you are handed a one size fits all version. I never thought I'd see snacks and burgers on the menu here. Even though we arrived in plenty of time and the restaurant was not full I still had to find someone to ask when our table would be ready. Also changed is the wine list and no longer is it a well organised and classy looking thing but now down graded to 2 sides of laminated A4 closey listing whats on offer. We got te distinct feeling that noone was in charge and noone really cared which was a stark contrast to our last visit. Even our bill was wrong.
